reviewText: Wonderful performance although the Dublin DVD is more entertaining. Worth the money. Downside is that there is too much Rieu. It is smaltzy when during the Lilac waltz he goes into a garden and points out the lilacs but that is Rieu. I would rather watch the orchestra than watch Rieu wander through towns.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Concert Master and showman Andre Rieu offers a meticulously thought out program and visual production in his '100 Years of Strauss' DVD.  The program showcases the range of Strauss' compositions: not only waltzes but a Mazurka and a Polka and a Gallop, among other types of offering.  The music and photography bring out the swirling giddiness of 'On the Blue Danube' Waltz, the tenderness and melancholy of his compositions from 'The Gypsy Baron' and  the classic Hungarian style of 'Eljen A Magyar.'This DVD shows a young and very handsome Andre Rieu on the concert stage in Vienna(!).  As usual, he has a full concert orchestra with him and they are beautifully attired--the women in wonderful gowns in a variety of pastel colors and cuts; the men elegant in formal white tie and tailcoats.  Aside from a very good level of musicianship, the orchestra members demonstrate a love of the music and an engagement with the audience and with each other as the perform.  What better way to capture the potential color and elegance and joy that could be a concert hall experience.  The whole aim of Andre Rieu seems to be to keep the 'life' in the genre of orchestral music, to avoid stuffiness and to keep the essence of this music before the public.The DVD even includes Rieu enjoying Vienna and its environs--moving the music out of the concert hall by showing the world that inspired it.  This part of the photography really enhances the viewing experience.Sound is fine on this production.  Andre's comments are delivered in some of his best English and are less stilted than sometimes, as well as being decently witty and usefully informative.

reviewText: I couldn't be happier with a DVD than I am with Andre Rieu's  100 Years of Strauss. Actually, I have bought several of Andre's DVD's from Amazon and am thrilled with all of them. Watching Andre and his orchestra, and listening to their invigorating music, vastly improves any evening! I highly recommend 100 Years of Strauss!

reviewText: This is a great concert.  I am looking forward to seeing Andre in person next time he comes to our area.This is my second DVD on his concerts.  Each concert is around 2hrs.  One of the best and most relaxing times to clear your mind, relax from everyday stresses.

reviewText: This is an early 2000 release by Andre Rieu. It is 60 minutes long. The music is OK and the presentation is OK. It is interesting to see how small the orchestra was at that time and what the players looked like then as compared to recent dvd's. Over all if you are looking for a short music show it is OK.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I love Andre Rieu!  I now own 7 DVDs of Andre, and saw him once in Las Vegas.  I have always loved waltzes, ever since I canremember, and I love music!  His orchestra is unique....instead of sitting just playing, they interact with each other, play little jokes on Andre, and seem to be having a wonderful time!  If you like a wide range of music,  other than Broadway, or pop, and rock,check out 100 YEARS OF WALTZES.  You could be in for a neat surprise!  Yay Strauss!
